{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is presenting with antepartum bleeding at 24 weeks' gestation. The physical examination shows a tender, bruised cervix with a closed cervical os. Ultrasound reveals a uniformly echogenic placenta located at the fundal end of the posterior uterine wall. These findings are consistent with a diagnosis of placenta previa, which is the most likely cause of the antepartum bleeding in this patient.", "answer_choice": "D"}
